11311122221.content:
Hermione was in the library, a quiet table towards the back. The table a warzone of scraps of paper, half-completed incantations. With mountains of books piled nearby, and rivers of parchment wending their way across the table.

Her face was decorated with scratches and spots of ink. Ironically it was Harry she needed, he had an intuitive grasp of magic. He knew how to mix spells, he didn't need that ... that book. It was the real reason for her anger, she knew Harry didn't need the Half-blood prince's cast offs.

Half an hour previously, she had dismissed a helpful Ron Weasley. Believing he was really looking for Harry, even if for different reasons. She certainly wasn't about to admit her mistake, or expose Harry's current condition to his best friend. Hermione knew how quickly it would spread to Fred and George, and from there to Peeves, and around the whole school.

She gave a low groan of frustration. For all her work, she didn't have a single way of tracking Harry.

Then inspiration hit. She snatched at one scrap of parchment, then another incomplete incantation on another piece of crumpled paper. Then looked with determination for a third. With low hissed, 'Yes', she smoothed out the three pieces of paper.

Between them she could craft a spell, a new piece of magic. She silently read the spell to herself, imagining the gestures. It felt right. Or at least she thought it did. Still a niggling doubt teased her, surely Harry didn't face this constant doubt.

With a resolute snort. She looked over the wreckage of the table. She'd done the research, she was sure it would work.

Cupping her left hand, she waved her wand around and around. The incantation flowing from her lips. A low yellow glow built between her fingers, illuminating her palm. The light slowly sharpened and took shape. The edges hardened, as it formed into a compass needle.

Finishing the incantation, she breathed a sigh of relief, and lowered her wand.

Shaking her left hand, the light vanished in an instant, becoming a faint yellow sand and drifting to the table surface.

It tore at Hermione to leave the books, and the library table in such chaos, but she needed to find Harry. He might be in imminent danger.

With a last sorrowful look at the mess, she left the library, and went find a quiet corner near the main stairs.

Again the glowing compass needle formed, and gave her a new bearing towards Harry. She barely paid attention to where she was going, just relentlessly following the directions she was given.

113111222212.content:
Peering around the edge of a hedge she heard, a gaggle of Slytherin girls chattering and giggling. Millicent Bullstrode, Pansy Parkinson, Flora Carrow... or maybe it was Hestia.

The Carrow sisters were ... Well, she'd never caught them doing anything in particular. But, she did get a very bad feeling when she looked at them, or talked to them. There was a coldness, an absence behind their eyes. Even at the Slug Club, they'd spoken little, and paused frequently, as if mentally reviewing their words, as if checking that they wouldn't reveal too much, or say something incriminating.

At the moment that was missing, as the three of them were talking animatedly. From the giggles, the glances and the cautious hands, it was clear that Pansy was bustier than before. While not something she paid a deal of attention to, it was hard to deny that Pansy suddenly looked like she was stuffing her bra.

In her hiding place, Hermione bit her lower lip. It was meant to be a simple transfiguration. However, unless Pansy was stuffing her new bra she'd made a mistake, and added an enhancement to Harry's new supporting role.

Ducking back, as she spotted Pansy look around with a rare nervous look. She ducked back behind the hedge. Quietly she peeled the branches back, enough to get a leaf framed view as Pansy flashed her very real, and very much bigger bust to her friends.

"Do you think Draco will like me now?" she asked with a laugh, but also a hint of more sincerity than she intended.

"He'll certainly like you more?" Flora... suggested. "I mean, look at Crabbe and Goyle, he does rather like the obvious."

The contempt in her voice had Pansy covering herself up, and cursing Flora quietly. Hermione saw her lips move furiously, but equally silently.

Hermione wanted to act, but couldn't with two witnesses. At least, Harry wasn't in imminent danger. Hermione decided to keep on following until they split up.

1131112222121.content:
Petrificus Totalus


Hermione doesn't have time to do anything before her body is frozen. As Hestia steps out, she nudges Hermione making her fall to the ground, in plain sight.

"Looks like we have a spy."

"No... It's a garden. It looks like we have a statue." Millicent's smile broad and evil. The girls huddle around Hermione, and move her to stand in the middle of a pond.

"I like the startled look, but a statue should embody the graces."

Modificio.

She tapped Hermione's frozen nose with her wand. A wave of warmth spread through her from head to toe.

Gleefully the girls arrange Hermione's unresisting limbs into a more elegant pose. One arm curved above her head, the other reaching forward.

Hermione's gaze darted from face to face, but the girls were competing, each striving to be crueller than the other.

The girls left her standing in the middle of the pond. The water flowing easily from their still dry, spell protected clothes.

A filthy, chuckle of lusty amusement came from Pansy.

"I think the next Herbology class will be here in an hour."

"We have to show Draco, his favourite Mudblood." Flora Carrow's voice tinged with more anger than amusement.

With a splash, Pansy trudged across to the frozen Hermione.

Her hands manipulating Hermione's features, until they formed a teasing pout. Her mouth slightly open, her lips full and rounded.

Petrificus Pietro.

Hermione's body lost it's healthy pinkness, as a chill spread out from Pansy's wand. Crackling like crushed gravel the chill spread to her extremities. Before her eyes, she saw her skin take on the colour, the patterning of granite.

Standing up on tip-toe, she kissed Hermione's cold stone lips.

"And now the final touch." she gave a theatrical curtsey to her cohorts. She ground her wand against the Gryffindor lion on Hermione's jumper.

Spreading out from that spot, Hermione's uniform unravelled. The threads drifting down from her body, only to turn to smoke in the air and blow away on the breeze. Even as stone, she felt the chill as her nakedness was revealed. The caress of the air teasing her perfect stony nipple. She was even able to see the cuffs of her blouse and jumper as they disintegrated before her eyes.

11311122221212.content:
The sound of students grew louder, Pansy's head turning towards the noise. She couldn't see much with the hedges in between them. But it... they were getting closer.

Millicent was gesturing for her to get out the water. The Carrow sisters were edging towards the hedges and bushes, looking for cover.

"She'll turn back in an hour." Millicent hissed, "On. her. own."

Pansy faked a calmness she didn't feel.

"I know, but I think our little addition deserves one last present."

Hestia and Flora were already half-hidden on the far side. Even Pansy found them a little unsettling, they had an unnatural coldness and distance in their every reaction. She raised her finger to her lips for silence. Millicent gritted her teeth, and beckoned for her to follow, as she too headed off to join the Carrows.

Pansy whispered in Hermione's stony ear. "Enjoy this..."

Taking out her wand she traced it down Hermione's spine, allowing the wood to slip between, her marble cheeks. Imprisoned and immobile, she wanted to twitch, and writhe, to ease her distraction. But the spell held her.

"Obliviate...." Pansy purred, as the magic seeped into the stone, Hermione's memories of the day evaporated like dew in the morning sun.

Desperately, she tried to see what was going on. Turn her head this way, or that. But she had no recollection of how she ended up here, or even of what she was doing. She was sure she recognised the Hogwarts gardens, but her immobility was terrifying.

Equally unsettling, was when she felt a tender kiss on her rump. It felt like ... like ... She didn't want to consider it. But it felt like they'd kissed her bare flesh, no hint of clothes between those lips and her flesh.

Behind her, their was a splashing, and some hissed words.

The words were indistinct, and soon drowned out by the other voices drawing nearer and nearer. A breeze passed through the garden, and Hermione felt it with every inch of her exposed flesh. Desperately she tried to flee, this coming humiliation. Of appearing naked for all to see.

She didn't know whether to feel insulted or relieved, as the students arrived. The round figure of Pomona Sprout toddling along behind them. None of them paid her a great deal of attention. Although, there was a flurry of whispers. They centred around the surprise at the new statue, and not what Hermione Granger was doing buck naked in the Gardens.

At least, this made things clearer to her. She'd been petrified.

113111222212121.content:
The class of Ravenclaw students sat down cross-legged on the ground. Pomona plucking various flowers, and passing them around. The love she felt for her subject filled every word she spoke. Her joy at the beauty and variety of the flowers, and the herbs... even of the insects that pollenate them. Her warm earthy nature in tune with her subject.

The students were soon drawing the various flowers that were passed around. Intricate drawings of the various leaves, with their various uses and dangers noted in careful script. These were true Ravenclaw students, dedicated and diligent.

Her eyes caught on one student's drawing. His large page wasn't covered with an sketch of a flower or a leaf. Instead, it was filling up with a different drawing. He had a deft touch, and a skill that Hermione envied. She loved her studies, but art was a skill she lacked. Her diagrams were stark and utilitarian.

As she watched, she saw he was drawing a gorgeous woman. It was only when she spotted the glances, that she realised, he was drawing her. That he was inspired by the new statue, that he was inspired by her.

As the picture filled in, Hermione saw the look on the statue's face. The lips slightly apart, an amused pout. One hand outstretched, elegantly, the other raised overhead in a balletic pose. The boy seemed to be oblivious to the face on his page. Hermione wanted to shake her head in denial, as her image developed on the page.

Pomona paused, entranced, then drew everyone's attention to the statue. Or rather to the glass-winged butterfly that had landed on her outstretched hand.

11513.content:
Harry wanted to impress Professor McGonagall with his transfiguration spells. An ability to conjure a disguise would be invaluable for someone hoping to be an Auror.

After careful (well some) research, Harry found that keeping to human form was the simplest, with a complete animagus form being the most difficult. Some were relatively simple, and while he had enjoyed Tonks' games with changing her nose, he doubted it would impress his Head of House.

Swallowing nervously, as the idea built he knew what he needed to do. A gender transformation was key. All he had to do was prove to the professor that it wasn't merely polyjuice. The girls bathroom was as quiet as ever, with only Moaning Myrtle occupying it. It's reputation wasn't helped after the discovery of the entrance to the Chamber of Secrets. 115323.content:
Harry wasn't sure why he was spending his free time in the Room of Requirement. Maybe it was because his friends were off on their own, or because he wanted to prevent Draco from using the room. Maybe he was looking for something to give him an edge against Voldemort. Or maybe he was in a place to hide from everyone else.

It really din't matter at the moment. It just meant spending a Friday night here instead of the library. It was quieter and the forgotten trove of books was worth reviewing. Not that he managed to get through most of them. About 90% of the titles were historical references, mainly for the goblin wars and various small skirmishes between magical communities. None of it was exciting. He did find a few spell books hidden amongst the shelves.

It took him nearly a month of wandering through numerous shelves and historical books. He lifted dusty tome after tome from the shelves, glanced at the title, flip to the pages, and place it back. Hours spent checking nothing only to find a single book: Vetiti Magicae Cartus.

The Cartus outlined several spells, most out of his league and skill. He found one that interested him, a single advanced transfiguration spell that required focus and a little luck. Very advanced, like past his NEWTS.

Harry sat at the desk the room provided and stared at the spell. He spent months practicing it, though without a target.His first attempt nearly caused him to blackout. With time, he barely felt the draw any more. The tug on his magic was still there, but it was different, fluid now. He was surprised how much the practice translated to improvement with his basic transfiguration skills. Now, just before Winter Break and a Hogsmeade weekend no less, he felt confident enough to try it out. The spell...

12.content:
Ron wanted to make his mark, the three friends were known for hanging around together. But Ron still felt he hadn't earned his place, he wasn't 'The Chosen One, The boy who lived, and he certainly wasn't 'The Smartest Witch of her generation'. Hell, the last significant thing, people talked about was his Wizard Chess game, and only his two friends had been there to see it.

So one quite night, he snuck three books out of the restricted section of the library. He set himself a goal, something that both his friends would want to learn, and that neither of them had attempted.

When the perfect spell hit him, he walked about with a smile all day long.

Neither Harry nor Hermione were animagi. But if even his rat could learn that, then surely he could too.

With that thought in mind he'd done some research into the subject.

Once the rest of his dorm had fallen asleep, he snuck them out of their hiding place.

'Transfigurations: For Fun and Vengeance.', a bit of research told him the author was a former Slytherin, and the title was done.

'Transfiguration 101', the author for that one was a Hufflepuff, so he found hope in that too. If a Hufflepuff could create these spells then surely a Gryffindor would be capable of learning them.

'Animagi: An introduction.'. This was the hardest, but the most intriguing, naturally enough it was written about a century ago, by a Ravenclaw student, who went on to become an Auror.

He pulled the sheets up, over his head.

Lumos.

He started to read.

125.content:
With his wand lighting the book beneath the sheets, Ron read through the passage about animagi. The chapter was quite short, and confirmed what he expected. The form an animagus took, reflected their personality. Ron nodded to himself as he thought over the different wizards and their animal forms. Peter Pettigrew becoming a rat, Rita Skeeter being a bug, Professor McGonagall a rather aloof cat.

His lips moved silently as he rehearsed the incantation. It wasn't terribly difficult, to find out. But even then, it still might not be possible for him to gain his animagus form. That spell was difficult. Drawing a deep breath, he settled his nerves. He wasn't sure how he'd react when he found it out. Suppose it was a timid mouse... or a bug himself... He tried to picture himself becoming a magnificent stallion. But a doubting smile quirked the corner of his mouth even now. But to be the first Weasley animagus, surely that was worth the risk. Even if it wasn't the most terrifying of creatures. Even a fierce grim, would be awesome, Ron thought. Surely his loyalty and friendship with Harry and Hermione would count in his favour.

"Well, I can always stop." he whispered to himself.

Beneath the incantation, and the wand gestures the bottom half of the page was blank. That was where his animal form would appear, an animated sketch of his future.

The wand flicks were tricky with his other hand holding the sheets up. But the book started to glow as he read out the spell. It pulsed brightly in time with his gestures, and he tapped the page with the tip of his glowing wand. Instantly, ink flowed in from the corners of the page, dancing and whirling, as they darkened and took on a clearer shape.

It was still impossible to make out, even now with the lines now clear and sharp. Half a dozen half glimpsed images came to mind, and vanished just as quickly.

As he looked up, she was already starting to chant beneath her breath. Her wand tracing an intricate shape in the air. The wand faltered, and he felt the air crackle as the magic dissipated.

"I just need to concentrate and visualise it." She answered Harry's unspoken question.

"So..." Harry started awkwardly, "Can you tell me what you'll transfigure me into..."

"Oh, just something I can visualise..."

Hermione continued as if she hadn't heard the question. "Something, I can feel, smell and experience."

Her cheeks were starting to redden, and Harry scowled at her. The awkward evasion collapsed.

1422.content:
The Quidditch Pitch was busy, as both Ravenclaw and Gryffindor wanted to practice in preparation for the first match. Ravenclaw had been flying all morning, as Cho spotted the huddle of Gryffindor students leaving the castle.

She had mixed feelings, as she saw Harry's mop of wild hair in the midst. Her thighs were aching from clenching tightly around her broom, and her face was streaked with grim from the rain, and the splashes of mud from low flying.

Gesturing to the approaching students and then to the ground, the team circled in a well-organised descent ready to surrender the ground to the Gryffindors. With Harry as the captain, she suspected Ron would 'earn' his place as the keeper. Looking around the stands, she wasn't surprised to see Hermione Granger, an impervious spell keeping the drizzling rain from her and the book in her lap.

When Hermione saw her glance, she waved and smiled, as she lead her team off to get changed.

She changed quickly jamming her Quidditch strip into the bag, and slipping on her regular clothes. Since it was Saturday, there weren't any classes, and she didn't have to wear the school uniform.

Briefly she considered watching them practice, but didn't want to talk to Harry. He just seemed to confuse her. Confuse her emotions....

So as she left the tent, she was almost running to get away... And so she careened into Harry knocking him to the ground.

But he just laughed it off. "You could be a beater, rather than a seeker." he said with a chuckle.

Cho helped him to his feet, and as he picked up his bag, he started cursing.

"What... What is it?" Cho asked, her strong Scottish accent making her sound harsher than she wanted.

"It's my strip... I've forgotten it." he said gruffly.

She knew his anger was directed at himself.

"I've been practising a spell." Cho said, settling a hand on his shoulder. He was turning to race back towards the castle.

As if stung, she withdrew her hand, "It's experimental." she added, Harry's gaze on her hand rather than her face.

"You can borrow mine." Cho offered, her cheeks reddening at her audacity. Pulling it from her bag, tapping it with her wand, she muttered a low incantation, and the yellow and blue shifted. Before Harry's eyes, even the eagle shifted, the stitching dancing before his eyes as it rewove itself into a lion rampant, in gold flecked thread.

It looked like his seeker's kit. Well, at the end of a long practice. The dirt was still intact ingrained into every seam and crevice of the strip.

Harry's head bobbed from side to side, as he weighed up the options. He didn't want to start as Captain by forgetting his strip, and he didn't want to offend Cho either, so reluctantly he took the uniform, and gave Cho his best sincere thanks.

She made her excuses, and darted away. A slightly confused Harry was left outside his tent listening to the building boasts, and concerns seeping out from the various changing tents around him. As the first potential recruits started emerging, he entered his tent to get changed.

Cho's muscles trembled in protest as she climbed the Quidditch tower.
14221.content:
Stripping off, Harry looked around the empty tent before examining the seeker's uniform properly. As if afraid it would change back to Ravenclaw colours. All the heavy leather padding was there too. Flipping it around, he saw even the back was changed, beneath the large number seven, Potter was written in capital letters.

But that didn't stop him cursing under his breath, as the obvious mistake they had both missed. It was still tailored for Cho. Luckily they were both similar in size and build, slender and short. With some carefully loosened straps he could make it fit.

Smirking to himself, he knew that at some point Cho would realise this herself. Opening up the trousers, a flash of white fell free. It was Cho's panties, plucking them off the grass he could still feel their warmth between his fingers. They were still damp with sweat too.
14221.title: Harry's surprise discovery.

choices: Harry outlined the team's practice session.
As time went on, the uniform was less and less distracting.
In the stands, Cho was becoming more agitated and worried.
142211.content:
A little surprised at himself, he slid them on. Feeling their cool satin caress his thighs as he pulled them upwards. At some point, he thought they'd become too tight, and he could abandon it as a joke. But they slipped into place, the elastic pinging against his bony hips, as his fingers slipped free.

"C'mon Harry." Ron voice called through the canvas, "They'll get restless."

Harry stood frozen to the spot, naked apart from his sweaty panties, afraid of being discovered.

He croaked, his mouth dry as a bone. Swallowing, he tried again, "Be... be right there."

As Ron's feet trudged away, Harry released the breath he'd been holding.

Scrambling into the seeker's outfit, he saw despite the Gryffindor colours and other changes it was cut for a female player. Being rather snug in some places, and looser in others. The shoulders were a squeeze, as he rolled them trying to get the uniform to fit better.

The teasing chill of satin, brushed his tiny male nipples, as they discovered the built-in support of his top.

He already felt committed and knew he couldn't change back now. Aware that every moment he was in the tent was another chance for someone to poke their head inside.

Looking over the protective padding and the cloak, he was happy that it at worst looked unisex, and at best wouldn't draw any more attention.

Clutching his broom like his slipping confidence he left the tent, before his nerve gave way.

Ron was only a few paces away, and the rest of the squad stood ready. From high in one of the stands he saw Hermione give him and Ron the thumbs up. He tried to hide his surprise as he spotted Cho sitting beside her.

Unbidden a smile crossed his face. He imagined Cho enthusing about Quidditch to a less fascinated Hermione. He resisted the desire to constantly pull at the uniform.
142211.title: A naughty thought occurs and Harry slips the pa...

choices: The quaffle knocks Harry to the ground, and unconsciousness.
Instictively, hunching forward the quaffle flew past Harry's shoulder.
The wet clothes made it essential, for Harry to adjust himself.
Squirming on his broom, Harry's uniform felt tighter across his hips.
1422112.content:
Harry started to regret his joking choice, once he was in the air. As the seeker, he circled high above, with a great view of the various patterns the team flew, and the smooth ways they shifted tactically in the air.

However, those damned panties were in their own Wronski Feint, as they dove deep, distractingly into his butt cleft. The desire to rip it free, to rip them off entirely was growing uncontrollably. But, even for a practice, Harry knew, there'd be all kinds of scopes and glasses focused his way. He knew Hermione worried, and was sure that Cho would be paying particular attention to him today, too.

Adjusting his grip on the broom seemed to help, or at least distract him from the wandering panties. As time wore on, the weather worsened, and Harry had other concerns to occupy his attention. The ill-fitting panties faded, the thong no longer over riding his thoughts. The cut of the material no longer crushing his crown jewels quite so intently.

Swooping down lower, he gave some advice to Fred and George. Always, a risky proposition, and some encouragement to Ron, hovering nervously near the goals.

Not wanting to over-do it, he rose higher, as a bludger chose that time to head in his direction. He was already dodging, and didn't see the quaffle Fred chucked in his direction.
1422112.title: As time went on, the uniform was less and less ...

choices: Harry went hunting for Cho!
Harry knew he needed Hermione's help, however humiliating it would be...
Harry ends the practice, as his voice starts to break.
Harry raced from the field, feeling the extra jiggle as she went.
Something else...
14221124.content:
Dispersing the team to their individual exercises. Harry steered his broom down to the ground. Hopefully, with everyone busy on their own, he could adjust himself without attracting any attention.

Acquam Sicco

He pointed the wand at his uniform, and a cloud of steam came from his clothes. The warmth pleasant without being too hot. Tugging at his top, he realised it felt baggy and loose. Dismissing that as his imagination, he gave his trousers a tug, they were clinging to his legs.

It was the second sensation that confirmed the first. His legs felt wrong. It wasn't his uniform that was too big... it was also too small. It felt tight around his hips. The borrowed panties leapt back into his mind, and he discovered why they weren't quite so snug, and confining.

Harry realised his ... his junk... lil' Harry had vanished. His hands explored finding more behind him too. A quick glance around to see in anyone was paying attention to him, confirmed he was shorter. His eyeline looked to be several inches lower.

Reluctantly, his hands rose. Pretending to adjust his uniform shirt. Harry found he was the proud bearer of a small, but unmistakable bust. The surge of sensation was unmistakable. The sensitivity totally distracting, and entirely unfamiliar. Thankfully the uniform was baggy enough to hide his revelation from any casual observers, and his distance hopefully meant those lost inches were invisible too.

Harry realised he was now a she. She swallowed sickeningly, 'The girl who lived', and hoped that her changes had run their course.

She tried not to whine, but inside her head, she wailed, "Isn't the scar enough... I don't need titties to draw any more attention."
14221124.title: Squirming on his broom, Harry's uniform felt wrong

choices: A Orginal Character
A Xover Character
15.title: A Orginal Character Or Xover

choices: Male
Female
151.title: Gender?

choices: More dragonriders emerge from the glowing blue sphere.
"Ruff! Tuff!!" she snarled angrily.
"I don't think Goethe expected this." she said to herself.
152.content:
High over the Astronomy tower, there was a flash. Bright enough to out dazzle the Sun. In the night sky, a new figure appeared. Or rather two figures.

The silhouette of a rider and dragon emerged from a blurry sphere of pale blue light. It was a dragon and rider.

http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/howt...

"Waoh, Stormfly...." a female voice called out.

There was a reptilian cry of concern, and the rider looked around the scenery as she tried to work out where she was?

Beneath her she saw an immense castle. It was bigger than the whole village of Berk.
152.title: An unexpected arrival.

info.brief_description: Transfiguration is branch of magic with so many possibilities.
info.description: Transfiguration is branch of magic with so many possibilities. You are Transfigured either by your self or another into a object (such as socks or shoes etc...) Either purposful or accidental this is your story
